text.p: - Slovenian Foreign Minister Zoran Thaler met his Hungarian counterpart Laszlo Kovacs on Tuesday, they discussed cooperation and the chances of the two states joining NATO in the first round of its enlargement.
- Prime Minster Janez Drnovsek called on trade unions and employers to sign an agreement on social benefits as soon as possible.
- Costs for opening custodian accounts for international portfolio investors should be lower in order to increase the competitiveness of Slovenian banks, the finance minister said.
- A four-day financial fair Kapital 97 was opened by Finance Minister Mitja Gaspari.
- The Slovenian government said it will ensure 3.2 billion tolars ($20.4 million) for science and research activities in the first half of this year.

- Papermill Radece said it managed to cut its 1996 losses to 127 million tolars from 1.7 billion in 1995. Radece planned to lift this year's paper production to 38,000 tonnes from 32,000 the previous year.
- The Slovenian government is expected to decide whether to increase drug prices by 6.3 percent on Thursday.
- Construction company SCT on Tuesday reported a 1996 profit of 26 million tolars, breaking out of the red for the first time in three years.
